title: Citi and the New York Mets Talk Savings with Kathryn Phelan School Students
summary: Queens, N.Y. – Citi and the New York Mets turned the Mets' ballpark, Citi Field, into a classroom as they gave Kathryn Phelan School students a personal finance lesson on saving is celebration of the 15th annual Teach Children to Save Day.
tag-1: Citi and the New York Mets Talk Savings with Kathryn Phelan School Students
tag-3: Queens, N.Y. – Citi and the New York Mets turned the Mets' ballpark, Citi Field, into a classroom as they gave Kathryn Phelan School students a personal finance lesson on saving is celebration of the 15th annual Teach Children to Save Day.
tag-4: "Citi is excited to team up with the Mets to share the 'financial facts of life' with Kathryn Phelan School students in celebration of the 15th annual Teach Children to Save Day," said Eileen Auld, Regional Director, Citi Community Development for New York and Connecticut. "Participating in Teach Children to Save Day every year since 2000 has allowed Citi volunteers to have a real impact in their communities, teaching financial education to thousands of young people."
tag-5: The Mets highlight the New York event, while earlier this week banker volunteers from across the country took time away from the office to give students financial education lessons. The volunteers incorporate hands-on scenarios and real-life experiences into lessons that explain the basics of saving, how interest makes money grow, how to create a budget and how to distinguish needs from wants.
tag-6: "Citi's continued participation in Teach Children to Save is so much more than financial education; it's an investment in America's future and the communities that Citi serves," explained Laura Fisher, executive director of the ABA Education Foundation, which sponsors the program.
tag-7: The Teach Children to Save program is a national campaign of volunteer bankers that for 15 years has helped young people develop lifelong savings habits. This year the campaign is on target to reach 5 million young people since it began in 1997, thanks to the dedication of more than 100,000 banker volunteers.
tag-8: The ABA Education Foundation The ABA Education Foundation provides financial education programs and resources that help bankers make their communities better. More than 100,000 bankers have taught basic finance skills to some 5 million young people through participation in the Foundation's signature programs, Teach Children to Save and Get Smart About Credit. Founded by bankers in 1925, the foundation is guided by a board of bankers and is an affiliate of the American Bankers Association. For more information, visit www.abaef.com or call 1-800-BANKERS.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-10: Citi Community Development Citi Community Development is leading Citi's commitment to achieve economic empowerment and growth for underserved individuals, families and communities by expanding access to financial products and services, and building sustainable business solutions and innovative partnerships. Our focus areas include: commercial and philanthropic funding; innovative financial products and services; and collaborations with institutions that expand access to financial products and services for low-income and underserved communities. For more information, please visit www.citicommunitydevelopment.com.
